summary: This bill, the Fair Audits and Inspections for Regulators’ Exams Act (FAIR Exams Act), aims to improve the examination process for depository institutions. It mandates timelines for examination reports, grants financial institutions the right to an independent review of material supervisory determinations, and establishes an Office of Independent Examination Review within the Federal Financial Institutions Examination Council. The bill also amends existing legislation regarding regulator appeals and ombudsman programs, and clarifies the role of the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection.
